item.title: [DISTRELEC-3935] Registration Links do not work (HP Q)
item.description:
Hi Raphael!

I saw the Property file was deployed for LT. Thank you for this.

I would like to ask teh etam to test and correct asap.

However the Register links do nort work. So it is a blocker for this activity.

PLease take a look
item.summary: Registration Links do not work (HP Q)

links on this page do not work:

http://test.distrelec.lt/register
Actually applies to all countries on HP Q, including CH, IT, AT
Has already been fixed for v1.1. Needs to be merged to v2.0.

They should point to http://test.distrelec.it/register/b2c and http://test.distrelec.it/register/b2b.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3857] internal searches not logged
item.description:
In the old system, company internal searches were not logged in the FF logfiles. How about the new system? I have the notion they turn up in the logfiles, do not know for sure, though.
If not yet done, they should be oppressed from this logfile.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3822] Unterschiedliche Suchresultate FF und Shop
item.description:
We're having different search results in FF and the web shop.

Here the answer from Mr. Türk:
der Fehler liegt in der Form des Suchbegriffs, welchen der Shop an FACT-Finder schickt. Über den SOAP-Webservice-Request wird der Begriff mit HTML-Entität übermittelt: rosace pour vis,noire
D.h. der Fehler müsste Shop-seitig behoben werden.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3813] Preisfeld mit effektivem Wert zu FF-Import hinzufügen
item.description:
Um das Feature "Ähnliche Produkte" (verantwortlich für Upselling-Kampagnen & Recos), freischalten zu können, brauchen wir in FF ein neues Preisfeld, das einen effektiven Wert enthält. Sprich: Neben dem heutigen Preisfeld mit Staffelung brauchen wir ein weiteres Feld mit einem einzigen Preiswert (Vorschlag: Nettopreis für 1 Unit).
Das Feld sollte keine Währungszeichen enthalten und durchgängig dasselbe Dezimaltrennzeichen verwenden. Als Dezimalzeichen muss ein Punkt verwendet werden. Es darf kein Tausendertrennzeichen vorkommen. Beispiel: 3456.99 (see documentation)
Gemäss E-Mail von Herrn Türk muss dem neuen Feld die entsprechende Rolle über den Einrichtungsassistenten zugewiesen werden, damit es für die "Ähnlichen Produkte" verwendet werden kann. Er hat weitere Details dazu.
item.summary: Preisfeld mit effektivem Wert zu FF-Import hinzufügen

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3779] FactFinder Export - Add Availability based on Warehouse
item.description:
Current Situation
Today FactFinder receives the availability information: Available or not (global over all warehouses) through true/false.

Very short Business Case
What we need to do to be able to handle backlog and deliveries is to downgrade results based on warehouse. For the CH site, products available in the CH site come first, then come DE, then come SE.

Change Request
The FactFinder Export needs to export in addition to the global availability, three new fields:

  • Availability for CH (true/false)
  • Availability for SE (true/false)
  • Availability for DE (true/false)
item.summary: FactFinder Export - Add Availability based on Warehouse

comments.comment:
Are there only those 3 warehouses in all salesOrgs? And how would external warehouses (Streckenartikel) have to be handled?

But either way, we would suggest a slightly different approach:

  • Export the availability information not per specific warehouse, but per
    • Primary warehouse of the salesOrg
    • Secondary warehouses of the salesOrg
  • This information is already available
  • This approach is more generic and future proof and will work for all sites likewhise.
  • This specifically also concerns FactFinder, where the config can be done more simply and generically

=> David, would you agree to this slightly changed approach?

David agrees.
Please use only the information as true or false.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2659] Import product EAN and add it to the FF export
item.description:
• Import the product EAN into hybris. (hybris attribute ean)
  • Replace the field Master in the FF export with the field EAN
item.summary: Import product EAN and add it to the FF export

comments.comment:
Dean,
can you please align with Cornel for an effort estimation?
As per Raphael and Florian, implementation for launch 1 would be desirable, but isn't mission critical.
Agreed with Florian to implement for CH/IT

Hi Cornel,

can you please make an estimation of the implementation effort. Thank you.
not required for CH/IT according to Florian and David

Estimation: 1.5 PD

Open Question:

  • How is the EAN information provided in the PIM XML file?
Raphael, please see the open question from Cornel

Hi David
Can you help me? How is the attribute called in the PIM export for the EAN information?
It's "ERP_EANCode". However this task is no priority.

Hi Cornel

See info from David.
Feature for v2.0 implemented.
Merged to v1.1

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2463] Optimize region cache
item.description:
During the load tests the overall cache statistics show a hit/ miss rate of 99%. In total this value
is good but still needs to be investigated in more detail detail. Only 68% of all Product data
requests and not a single PriceRow request were answered by the cache. The standard cache sizes
have not been changed although the cache size is not constrained as Distrelec has licensed the
hybris High Performance option.

Recommendation: Improve the cache hit/miss ration by changing its parameters,
e.g. size or eviction strategies.
see https://wiki.hybris.com/display/release4/Region+Cache

comments.comment: We wait for experience with CH traffic before increasing cache from 100'000 to 300'000 entries.

Adrian,
do we have first conclusions from CH traffic analysis?

Increasing the cache size does currently not make much sense. With 100'000 items we reach a hit ratio of about 95%. After increasing cache size to 300'000 items the hit ratio increased only little to 96%. However, we have to find out why certain items are rather being cached. E.g. StockLevel, ProductFeature and DistSalesOrgProduct have a very poor hit ratio.

=> 5% cache misses generate still a big load on the database. Current numbers: 14'637'426 misses during 24h => average 170 sql statements per second (on every server).

1) Change Strategy from FIFO to "last touched"
2) check cache hit ratio
3) increase cache size
4) check

  • memory consumption
  • cache hit ratio
  • average 170 sql statements per second (on every server).
  • would be great to be able to check the load on the DB before and after the change

Before we start optimizing, I checked the cache hit ratio again (01.05.2014). On all nodes 1..4 we have the same ratio values:

  • 99% hit ratio for typesystemCacheRegion
  • 97% hit ratio for entityCacheRegion (100% of cache size used)
  • 95% hit ratio for queryCacheRegion

@Adi

How did you check the values of:

  • statements per second (hmc) ?
  • cache hit ratio (hmc,jconsole) ?

I assume the "memory consumption" will be OK since you already increased to 300000 item in cache.

Did you already change the strategy (FIFO) ?

Thanks
René

@René:

  • Statements per second (just a roughly number) => switch on JDBC logging for 1 min and count lines
  • Cache hit ratio can be found in hAC => http://10.191.20.141:9001/hac/monitoring/cache
  • No, I did not yet change the eviction policy.

I did a short test using 300'000 items. But those days the number of sessions were lower!

My recommendation:

1) Change cache strategy for next deployment.
2) Monitor the system the day after
3) Increase cache for the next deployment
3) Monitor the system the day after

Effort approx. 1PT

@Florian

Bitte das weitere Vorgehen definieren.
Bitte umsetzen.

Changed for R1.1 (to have time to monitor after the deployment) :

regioncache.entityregion.evictionpolicy=LFU
regioncache.querycacheregion.size=40000
